(Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from outside the Chicago Board of Trade.)  Chicago has long been the center of the American grain trade; in 1930, an aluminum statue ofthisRoman goddess of grains was placed atop the Chicago Board of Trade building to symbolize the city's  agricultural roots
